docTitle.titlePart: High throughput protein expression screening system

byline.docAuthor: Roumen A. Bogoev, Raul L. Manzanedo, Joseph W. Amshey, and Barbara Flynn,

front.div:
Abstract
Using the currently available products and protocols to screen a large number of
samples expressing recombinant proteins is a very time consuming and tedious
process. We demonstrate an expression screening system that addresses this problem
by providing a simple and fast method suitable for high throughput use.
Maltose binding protein-mIL2 fusion protein (MBP-mIL2), *thioredoxin-DEADbox
(TDB) fusion protein and green fluorescent protein (GFP) expressed in E.coli; GFP
and CDK4 proteins expressed in Sf21 insect cells; and Î²-galactosidase expressed in
Pichia were screened using this system. In 30 minutes, the soluble and insoluble frac-
tions from these expression cultures were obtained.
The system is capable of extracting proteins from very high density cultures without
clogging the filter. This is useful in situations where low protein expression is
observed. We have demonstrated extraction of MBP-mIL2 fusion protein from con-
centrated E.coli cell culture with an OD600 of up to 15.
